channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2023100758
item.description:
Report E-2023100758

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 16, 2023, one (1) one-gallon jug of UN1903 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) ounces of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents powder to remediate the UN1903-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100638
item.description:
Report E-2023100638

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN1760 Previsto release from a 135-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to the top of the tote due to being crushed by concrete pavers falling on the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents and PPE into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2023100683

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING/WET IN THE LOADSIDE AREA. UPON INSPECTION, ONE OF FOUR GLASS JUGS BECAME BROKEN. PACKAGE SECURED AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION. DescribePack: 1 GLASS JUG BECAME BROKEN. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE SECURED IN A PLASTIC BAG AND TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT STATION.

item.title: Report X-2023100137
item.description:
Report X-2023100137

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: BRASELTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: wET HAZMAT BOX WAS FOUND ON FLOOR. Upon inspection, all 4 of the plastic bottles were leaking from the seal and the caps. Caps were loose and leaking. Spill was cleaned with proper PPE and placed in salvage drum. DescribePack: all 4 of the plastic bottles were leaking from the seal and the caps. Caps were loose and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill was cleaned with proper PPE and placed in salvage drum.

DescribePack: top was not on the container tight, and the liquid has leaked out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to the QA area once it was noticed that there was a spill.

item.title: Report X-2023100133
item.description:
Report X-2023100133

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: BRASELTON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100133 SequenceEvent: Punctured and dented steel drum found by load area 4. Damage was along the side of the body and leaking near the bottom. Heavy box had fallen atop of steel drum causing puncture and leak. Used PPE to clean spill and placed in savage drum. DescribePack: Damage was along the side of the body and leaking near the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Used PPE to clean spill and placed in savage drum. 2. X-2023100502 SequenceEvent: Steel drum was found dented and bent leaking from the seal near the bottom of the container, also very dented at the top. Proper PPE was used to clean spill and placed in salvage drum for further handling. DescribePack: Dented and bent leaking from the seal near the bottom of the container, also very dented at the top. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Proper PPE was used to clean spill and placed in salvage drum for further handling.
